title: Altria Stock Is Falling Over Worries About Its Stake in Juul Labs
text:
Altria Group stock was falling Tuesday morning, following news that Juul Labs will cut its labor force as it regroups in the face of potential vaping-related health concerns.

The back story. Traditional cigarette use in the U.S. is declining, which has left big tobacco firms searching for a path forward to embrace a cigarette-free future. While Philip Morris International (ticker: PM) has developed its own vaping device iQOS, Altria (MO) has taken a different tack, including investments in several cigarette alternatives....
description: The cuts mark a reversal from earlier in the year, when Juul’s ranks had swelled to more than 4,000, as hundreds of new hires were brought on each month until a hiring freeze in September.
